questions.text: How many silver scrolls did Pawtucket Pat place in his beers?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Immediately after he heard the news, Peter starts drinking all of the beers he can find.  He and Brian spend a whole night drinking beer.

Alexis & Alexis Radcliffe.

	Alexis beats Lois at every piano competition, and this year, Lois wants to win really bad, but she has no good pupils to play at the competition.

Joe.

	Joe gets the first scroll, and he decides to take his son Kevin with him to the brewery tour.  Peter deduces after extensive calculations that three more scrolls are left.

questions.text: What does Tom Tucker insert into his brain when he reveals that one scroll still remains unfound?
questions.explanation:
An earwig.

	Although Tom is screaming about the carnivorous earwig eating out the back of his eyes, Diane Simmons continues with the day's news.  Peter finds the fourth scroll shortly after.

questions.text: What job does Jerry Nelson have?
questions.explanation:
Ninja.

	Jerry Nelson found the second or third scroll and took his wife Janey to the Pawtucket Brewery.

questions.text: Who does Peter bring into the Pawtucket Brewery?
questions.explanation:
Brian.

	Brian and Peter end up taking Perma-suds and are kicked out of the factory.  Joe is kicked out first because the building has no wheelchair ramp.

questions.text: What helps Peter play the piano?
questions.explanation:
Beer.

	When Peter becomes drunk, he plays piano better than anyone, so Lois enters him into the piano competition.

questions.text: What day of the week is the piano recital on?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	Unluckily, all of the liquor stores in Quahog are closed, so Peter and Lois have to go to an underage drinking party to get Peter drunk for the competition.

Yes.

	Although Lois had to have Peter drunk the whole time, she still beat Alexis for the first time.  Lois brought home the gold trophy which was considerably smaller than the previous year's trophy.

questions.text: Does the "Family Guy" theme play during the end credits?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The sad "walking away" music from "The Incredible Hulk" plays while Stewie is hitchhiking just like Bruce Banner did.
